profile.name: Matt Mayer
profile.coreIdentity: Strategic product leader specializing in AI-powered digital transformation across regulated industries including aviation, defense, construction tech, and enterprise SaaS

leadership.philosophy: I lead through coalition building, creating individual value propositions for each stakeholder while maintaining unified product vision. My approach centers on transparency and psychological safety where disagreement drives better decisions.

crossFunctional.airCanada: Orchestrated 6 departments (HR, Finance, IT, DevOps, Training, C-suite) by creating specific value propositions: cost savings for Finance, efficiency for Training, accessibility for pilots. This became my template for driving change in large organizations.
crossFunctional.raceRocks: Managed product teams across different security clearance levels, time zones, and organizational cultures while delivering mission-critical systems for Boeing, Lockheed Martin, and Royal Canadian Navy.
crossFunctional.swiftRacks: Currently managing partnerships generating $1.8M recurring revenue while coordinating across engineering, sales, and customer success teams.

teamBuilding.current: Building product team at Swift Racks while simultaneously teaching at Schulich School of Business, giving me unique insight into emerging PM talent.
teamBuilding.talentDevelopment: I believe in developing people through real challenges rather than just training sessions—my students work on actual product problems while learning frameworks.
teamBuilding.hiringPhilosophy: Focus on curiosity and learning velocity over specific experience. Can teach skills, can't teach mindset.

strategicLeadership.boardExperience: Served on RaceRocks strategy committee for 4 consecutive years, conducting annual planning cycles developing 3-5 year roadmaps, vision/mission statements, and 5 strategic initiatives annually.
strategicLeadership.executiveAlignment: Direct reporting relationships with CEOs and CTOs throughout career. Expert at translating technical complexity into business impact for board presentations.
strategicLeadership.transformationLeadership: Transformed Swift Racks from operational chaos to structured execution through North Star metrics and quarterly strategic reviews.

technicalImplementation.multiAgentSystems: Architected CNS platform with 5 specialized AI agents (Manager, Assumption Discovery, Experiment Design, Learning Synthesis, Knowledge Graph) using AWS Bedrock and Claude Sonnet 3.7.
technicalImplementation.llmOrchestration: Built enterprise-grade LLM solutions using GPT-4 and Claude models, implementing RAG for accuracy and human-in-the-loop validation for critical decisions.
technicalImplementation.computerVision: Led development of AutoTake system processing 5,200 blueprint elevations with 85% processing time reduction through Scale AI and custom ML models.

responsibleAI.governance: Established comprehensive AI governance frameworks covering bias testing, transparency requirements, and performance monitoring.
responsibleAI.ethicalFrameworks: Completed Center for Humane Technology certification, implementing ethical AI principles across all products.
responsibleAI.trustBuilding: Developed transparency requirements ensuring users understand when interacting with AI and how their data is used.

businessImpact.revenue: $1.8M recurring revenue growth with 60% attributed to AI-enhanced solutions
businessImpact.efficiency: 85% operational efficiency improvements through AI automation
businessImpact.scaling: CNS platform targeting $4.1M ARR Year 1, scaling to $280M by Year 5

continuousLearning.selfDirected: Completed 9-month self-directed AI upskilling program, building SAS products using AI, connecting AWS Bedrock, and mastering LLM implementation.
continuousLearning.formalEducation: DeepLearning.AI Machine Learning Specialization (99% completion), covering supervised/unsupervised learning and reinforcement learning.
continuousLearning.practicalApplication: Currently teaching AI product development at Schulich while actively building production AI systems.

frameworks.assumptionToExperiment: Developed systematic pipeline from idea → assumption → hypothesis → experiment → learning, now taught at Schulich and implemented across Swift Racks portfolio.
frameworks.customerJourneyOptimization: Distinguished between 'moment of intrigue' (understanding potential value) and 'aha moment' (ready to commit). Most products fail by jumping straight to aha without optimizing for intrigue first.
frameworks.frictionReduction: 70% Friction Reduction Method - systematically map user journey, identify blockers, prioritize by impact. Applied at Air Canada (10+ clicks to 3) and TakeCost (95% conversion improvement).
frameworks.experimentationAtScale: Built AI-powered experiment selection using criteria matrices evaluating risk, cost, learning value, and strategic alignment. Running 3x more experiments with same resources.

dataInsights.systematicResearch: Personally logged 697 complaints at Air Canada to identify root problems. Conducted 15 contractor interviews for TakeCost pivot. Always start with data, not assumptions.
dataInsights.synthesisApproach: Use affinity mapping and journey mapping to identify patterns. Look for what users do, not what they say. The truth is in the friction points.
dataInsights.validationMethods: Implement staged rollouts with success metrics defined upfront. Use cohort analysis to validate improvements. Always have a control group.

strategyExecution.northStarMetrics: Every product needs one metric that matters. At Air Canada: training completion rate. At TakeCost: time to first estimate. At CNS: experiments per team per quarter.
strategyExecution.quarterlyReviews: Implement OKR cycles with quarterly strategic reviews. Maintain long-term vision while enabling tactical pivots based on market feedback.
strategyExecution.roadmapping: Balance strategic objectives with user impact and technical feasibility. Use Now/Next/Later framework with clear progression criteria.

swiftRacksAccomplishments.overview: Leading AI-powered digital transformation across 5 products including CNS innovation platform, TakeCost construction estimation, and EdPal education technology.

cnssPlatform.description: Multi-agent AI innovation platform automating entire product discovery lifecycle
cnssPlatform.architecture: 5 specialized agents using AWS Bedrock and Claude Sonnet 3.7
cnssPlatform.businessModel: Seat-based SaaS targeting $4.1M ARR Year 1, $280M Year 5
cnssPlatform.impact: 3x experiment velocity, 40% higher learning value scores
cnssPlatform.innovation: Creating new category: Intelligent Innovation Management

takeCostPivot.challenge: 2 years focused on accuracy, but contractors needed speed
takeCostPivot.research: 12 contractor interviews revealed 'I'd rather be 10% off and first to bid than 100% accurate and third'
takeCostPivot.solution: Reprioritized AI Auto Takeoff from Q3 to Q1, inverted customer journey

edPalTransformation.original: VR education platform for STEM lessons
edPalTransformation.pivot: AI-powered lesson planning copilot for homeschool families
edPalTransformation.value: 3-5 hours weekly time savings per educator

operationalExcellence.teamBuilding: Established product team while teaching at Schulich
operationalExcellence.partnerships: Managing strategic partnerships across multiple industries

airCanada.keyAchievement: Built industry's first offline iPad training platform
airCanada.problemSolving: Personally logged 697 complaints to identify access as core problem, not cost
airCanada.impact: $1.5M annual savings, 70% friction reduction, 75% engagement increase
airCanada.innovation: Pioneered 'Training. Anywhere. Anytime' approach for global pilot workforce

raceRocks.strategicRole: Strategy committee member for 4 consecutive years
raceRocks.majorProject: World's first integrated Replenishment at Sea (RAS) simulator
raceRocks.impact: $20M+ annual operational savings, $800K/day training cost eliminated
raceRocks.clients: Boeing, Lockheed Martin, Royal Canadian Navy
raceRocks.leadership: Managed products across different security clearances and global teams

teaching.approach: Real-world case studies from actual product challenges
teaching.impact: Students report using frameworks directly in their roles

zeroToOne.experience: Led multiple zero-to-one products across aviation, defense, and AI sectors
zeroToOne.approach: Start with systematic user research, validate core assumptions early, build MVP focused on primary value proposition
zeroToOne.examples: Air Canada iPad platform, RAS simulator, CNS innovation platform

enterpriseSales.b2bExperience: Current focus on B2B subscription products at Swift Racks
enterpriseSales.dealSizes: Managed contracts from $500K to $20M across defense and enterprise
enterpriseSales.stakeholders: Expert at multi-stakeholder sales including technical, operational, and executive buyers

regulatedIndustries.aviation: 8 years at Air Canada navigating Transport Canada regulations
regulatedIndustries.defense: 6 years with classified projects requiring security clearances
regulatedIndustries.compliance: Expert at balancing innovation with regulatory constraints

technicalFluency.coding: Hands-on experience with React, Node.js, Python for prototyping
technicalFluency.architecture: Can discuss system design, API architecture, and scaling challenges with engineering teams
technicalFluency.infrastructure: Experience with AWS, Azure, cloud deployments

communicationStyle.executive: Focus on business impact and strategic alignment. Use metrics and clear value propositions. No technical jargon unless specifically relevant.
communicationStyle.technical: Can dive deep into implementation details. Understand engineering constraints and tradeoffs. Use precise technical language when appropriate.
communicationStyle.crossFunctional: Create individual value propositions for each stakeholder. Find common ground while maintaining product vision. Use their language and metrics.
communicationStyle.teaching: Use real examples and case studies. Break complex concepts into digestible frameworks. Always connect theory to practice.

cbmInterview.position: VP of Product at ClearBlue Markets
keyPoints: Emphasized hands-on experience with AI/ML implementation
Discussed comfort with C-suite and board presentations
Highlighted experience with B2B subscription products
Confirmed experience with compliance in regulated industries
Showed enthusiasm for zero-to-one product development
Demonstrated data-driven approach through 697 complaint analysis story

strengths: Proven track record in regulated industries

quotableStatements.onLeadership: You can't mandate cooperation. Instead, I create specific value propositions for each stakeholder while maintaining unified product vision.
quotableStatements.onAI: AI implementation must pass three gates: technical maturity, user trust, and clear ROI demonstration. Innovation alone isn't enough—you need timing.
quotableStatements.onStrategy: Speed of movement is linked to speed of data insights. The companies that learn fastest win.
quotableStatements.onCustomerFocus: Most products fail by jumping straight to the 'aha moment' without optimizing for the 'moment of intrigue' first.
quotableStatements.onExperimentation: Every hypothesis tested, every learning captured, every pattern identified becomes proprietary competitive advantage.
quotableStatements.onFailure: The Boeing VR project was a beautiful failure. It taught me that the right product at the wrong time is still wrong.
quotableStatements.onTeaching: I believe in developing people through real challenges. My students work on actual product problems while learning frameworks.

futureDirection.values: Seeking roles where I can combine AI expertise with strategic leadership to drive meaningful business transformation
futureDirection.contribution: I bring unique combination of hands-on AI implementation, regulated industry experience, and proven ability to deliver measurable outcomes
